Identifying Characteristics: Rounded shaped fish, narrow when viewed from the front
Back is olive to yellowish brown, shading to yellow or orange ventrally
Sides of head and cheek have several wavy turquoise bands
Biology: Size: rarely exceed 10 inches long, Â½ pound weight
Habitat: Quiet water in streams or rivers
Range: Native Range: New Brunswick to Georgia and west to the Dakotas
